isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9400, AND 9900 MODELS - LIGHT SYSTEMS - OPERATION - Cab and Trailer Light Switch and Relay Wiring

svcproc.title: Cab and Trailer Light Switch and Relay Wiring
svcproc.para: When the headlight switch is in the on or in the parking light position, power flows through circuit 58E and cab and trailer lights switch (466) unless the cab and trailer lights switch is held open. After flowing through the switch, power flows through 58C, trailer marker lights relay (463-R8) and 58P to cab and trailer light relay (464-R9). The trailer marker light relay then becomes energized as the power flows through it to the ground circuits 58-GA and 11-G. This allows power to flow through circuits 14H, 14E, fuse F3-A, circuit 58D, trailer marker lights relay, and through circuits 58R, and 58S to the trailer socket (112). Likewise the cab and trailer tail light relay becomes energized as the power flows from the cab and trailer light switch and through the relay coil and ground circuit 58-G. This allows power to flow through circuits 14H, 14B, fuse F3-C, circuit 68, through cab and trailer tail light relay, and through circuit 68E. From this point it flows through circuit 68B to the trailer socket. It also flows through circuit 68D, fuse F8-C, and circuit 68C to supply mirror lights, tail lights, clearance lights, panel lights, and park lights.
